main event: On March 30, 1967, witnesses in Albany, Oregon observed a fireball and two unidentified objects in the sky.
interesting points: The fireball was described as a large bright body that crashed with a long trail., Witnesses reported two objects, one moving from north to south and the other from east to west, intersecting each other's paths., One object was reported to be traveling twice as fast as the first., Witnesses were scanning the sky, looking for a satellite, when the sighting occurred., No physical evidence or photographs were documented for the sighting.
witness description: Civilian witnesses observing the night sky
